page.title: 13LIBRARY
page.content: complete set of{Clydebank Town Council minutes from the formation of Clydebank as a burgh,annual reports of the medical officer of health from 1936-1972 and the Sanitary Inspector from 1915-1973,valuation roll from 1915 and various local maps and manuscripts dating from the mid 19th century. {A survey}was taken in the library to find out various ideas about the library.Those talked to,borrowed mainly from the book lending section and took a mixture of fictional and non_fictional books with a few borrowing from the children's,video and record sections.Those using the library did so because it was{local. The frequency of visits ranged from 2-3 times a week to 4 times a year and most people were happy with the range of books and the library as a whole.
